meanings.definition: Without the right or ability to vote.
meanings.sent1: The voteless citizens felt left out during the election.
meanings.sent2: She was considered voteless because she hadn't registered to vote.
meanings.sent3: The cat, being voteless, couldn't decide on the best flavor of cat food.
meanings.sent4: The voteless trees stood silently as the wind decided their fate.
meanings.sent5: The voteless students longed to have a say in the school's new policy.

meanings.definition: Lacking the power or privilege to participate in voting.
meanings.sent1: The protest aimed to give a voice to the voteless population.
meanings.sent2: He felt frustrated being voteless in such an important decision.
meanings.sent3: The voteless penguin tried to join the voting line but was gently turned away.
meanings.sent4: The voteless flower wilted in the garden, unable to choose its spot in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The voteless committee member could only watch as others made the final decision.
